oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: How to Plan for a Consumer Services Cooperative
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Booklet on how to plan a consumer services cooperative that would provide goods to their community at a lower cost than retail stores. This booklet was distributed to participants at the first Farmer-Labor school in 1947.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Shipherd, Henry; Thompson, Estelle
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Labor unions--Organizing--United States; Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Communities; Consumers; Consumer cooperatives; Cooperative societies; Milk; Coal; Delivery of goods; Tennessee Farm Bureau; Women in the labor movement
